text: @hayulls @JWillson1 @Lucy_Lapwing @LGSpace @Buzz_dont_tweet @DandelionAppre1 @Love_plants @wildflower_hour @WildFlowerSoc @BiodiversitySoS @MeadowInGarden @DaveGoulson @RewildingB @banburyfm @banburynews @Cherwellcouncil @TownEvents @EnvAgency In the past I have intervened and stopped someone from spraying if I felt the situation warranted it - but then I have the licences and have used that equipment in a professional capacity (I also know all the short-cuts and why they are taken)

Poisonous Hydrogen Sulphide stench stronger than ever in North Staffordshire tonight. Clear sign @RedIndustries2 can’t/won’t sort this. Time now to shut down Walleys Landfill until such time as @EnvAgencyMids able to confirm no more poisonous emissions @AbiBrown1 #StopTheStink.

@hayulls @JWillson1 @Lucy_Lapwing @LGSpace @Buzz_dont_tweet @DandelionAppre1 @Love_plants @wildflower_hour @WildFlowerSoc @BiodiversitySoS @MeadowInGarden @DaveGoulson @RewildingB @banburyfm @banburynews @Cherwellcouncil @TownEvents @EnvAgency The chap should be wearing a 'noddy suit' (protective overalls), should certainly be wearing gloves, a face mask or visor. Worth asking if he has PA1 and PA6A licences to be using the knapsack. Also ask what they are spraying. There should be signage up as well...
